page.title: 20 I thought I saw.......
page.content: There are several ghostly manifesta- tions in the area. Monmouth is the highest ranked. His carriage and outriders are to be seen by the Friends' Meeting House. Amongst sev- eral houses haunted are Manor House Farm which has a rather nice young man who visits. An unnamed house has two ghosts. One, a little old lady who tucks the children up, and the other a rather unpleasant man who whispers. To the East of Load Bridge, many people have heard the sounds of fighting and dying men. Many attribute these sounds to the Civil War, but they could easily be a hang-over from the Roman occupation, or even the Spanish Armada. A large black dog haunts Wet and Dry Crouds, disappearing after crossing Littlefields lane.
